Journal.Title: Huan jing ke xue= Huanjing kexue

Article.ArticleTitle: [Spatial-temporal Variation and Driving Factors of Ozone in China from 2019 to 2021 Based on EOF Technique and KZ Filter].

AbstractText: Based on the hourly O<sub>3</sub> concentration data of 337 prefectural-level divisions and simultaneous surface meteorological data in China, we applied empirical orthogonal function (EOF) analysis to analyze the main spatial patterns, variation trends, and main meteorological driving factors of O<sub>3</sub> concentration in China from March to August in 2019-2021. In this study, a KZ (Kolmogorov-Zurbenko) filter was used to decompose the time series of O<sub>3</sub> concentration and simultaneous meteorological factors into corresponding short-term, seasonal, and long-term components in 31 provincial capitals.Then, the stepwise regression was used to establish the relationship between O<sub>3</sub> and meteorological factors. Ultimately, the long-term component of O<sub>3</sub> concentration after "meteorological adjustment" was reconstructed. The results indicated that the first spatial patterns of O<sub>3</sub> concentration showed a convergent change, that is, the volatility of O<sub>3</sub> concentration was weakened in the high-value region of variability and enhanced in the low-value region.Before and after the meteorological adjustment, the variation trend of O<sub>3</sub> concentration in different cities was different to some extent. The adjusted curve was "flatter" in most cities. Among them, Fuzhou, Haikou, Changsha, Taiyuan, Harbin, and Urumqi were greatly affected by emissions. Shijiazhuang, Jinan, and Guangzhou were greatly affected by meteorological conditions. Beijing, Tianjin, Changchun, and Kunming were greatly affected by emissions and meteorological conditions.
